meanings.definition: A person or animal that sucks blood, especially a vampire.
meanings.sent1: The bloodsuckers in the movie were terrifying creatures that drank blood to survive.
meanings.sent2: The villagers were convinced that the bloodsuckers lurking in the shadows were responsible for the mysterious disappearances.
meanings.sent3: The bloodsuckers at the costume party were so convincing that they actually scared some of the guests.
meanings.sent4: The tabloids described the corrupt politicians as bloodsuckers, draining the city of its resources.
meanings.sent5: The image of bloodsuckers feasting on innocent victims haunted her dreams.

meanings.definition: A leech or other parasitic organism that feeds on blood.
meanings.sent1: After swimming in the lake, she found a bloodsucker attached to her leg, feeding on her blood.
meanings.sent2: The doctor warned about the dangers of bloodsuckers in tropical regions, advising travelers to take precautions.
meanings.sent3: The bloodsucker in the pond seemed to have a taste for her blood, always latching onto her whenever she went swimming.
meanings.sent4: The greedy corporation was likened to a bloodsucker, draining the small businesses of their profits.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the bloodsucker engorged with blood made her shudder in disgust.
